Ingredients.5: 1 cup cold butter, cut into 1/2-inch pieces

Ingredients.9: 2  ripe peaches, peeled and cut into 1-inch pieces

Ingredients.10: 1.5 tablespoons white sugar, divided, or more to taste

Directions.1: Place flour in a medium bowl. Whisk in sugar and salt. Cut in butter using 2 knives or a pastry cutter. Gently work in cream cheese and sour cream until dough is combined.

Directions.2: Turn dough out onto your working surface. Quickly gather crumbs together into a square; fold square in half. Flatten dough out into a larger square using a rolling pin; fold in half again. Roll out one more time and fold into thirds, like a letter. Wrap dough in plastic wrap. Chill until firm, about 1 hour.

Directions.3: Mix peaches, 3 tablespoons sugar, and cinnamon in a small bowl. Let sit for about 15 minutes. Transfer filling mixture into a strainer over a bowl to drain the excess juices for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.

Directions.4: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.

Directions.5: Roll pastry dough onto a floured surface to about 3/8-inch thickness. Cut out 15 to 20 circles about 4- to 6-inches in diameter. Place 2 teaspoons of filling into the middle of each circle. Fold dough in half over the filling and seal edges together with your fingers. Press edges together with the tines of a fork to make a decorative seal, if desired.

Directions.6: Place empanadas on the prepared baking sheet; brush with egg and sprinkle with remaining sugar.

Directions.7: Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 12 to 15 minutes. Remove from oven and let cool for 5 minutes before serving.
